characters: EPIPHANY. BLOODY CHRIST ON THE CROSS. HALLELUJAH
AT THE RENDEZ-VOUS WITH THE BOOKIE

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: LT enters an APARTMENT BUILDING, faces a dark and siniste staircase. STRANGE NOISES come from the APARTMENTS ABOVE. LT climbs. He hugs the wall, GUN at the ready. To LT, it  seems some gothic horror may await him at any turn. On one landing, he comes upon a PIT-BULL. A GRANDMOTHER p him back inside an APARTMENT by the LEASH. On another landing, he sees a JUNKIE SHOOTING UP in the  shadows. On another landing, a BIG GUY comes barreling ou of his APARTMENT and down the stairs, almost bringing LT  down with him. On another landing, a guy is taking out very PECULIAR GAR It might be body parts to an active imagination. At last, reaches the DOOR to the APARTMENT for which he's been loo

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A cheerful apartment. Quite different in atmosphere from STAIRWELL, above. A large, multi-generation PUERTO RICAN FAMILY sits around the dinner table, eating CHICKEN ON RICE AND BEANS. JC is the table. RELIGIOUS ARTIFACTS abound. A CODED KNOCK on the DOOR. JC jumps up to answer it. It's LT. (The hideous stairs led here.) JC lets him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Very good. The Mets are  gonna win tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JC notes LT's bizarre manner. Decides to humor his parano catatonia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Here. Just a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JC reaches into a bookcase, looking for something. Meanwhile, LT looks around the room. POV LT - A SHRINE is in the corner. CANDLES are lit befor PLASTER SAINTS, AFRICAN DEITIES, other icons abstruse and exotic. A large "MADONNA AND CHILD", painted on black vel hangs above the SHRINE. The MADONNA AND CHILD are BLACK. LT takes this all in. JC startles him. JC is holding a CIGAR BOX. He opens it. It's full of CASH JC hands it to LT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should be it. Oh, wait. (to an old woman at  the table) Mamacita?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAMACITA takes some VIALS of CRACK out of her APRON. SMILES. JC takes them from her, give them to LT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Now you've got your profit  and more. You'll have more product  day after tomorrow, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very spaced) Uh - right. Sure. The Mets are gonna  win tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. (beat - looks at LT  with concern) Take care of yourself, man, OK? Be  cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT nods, puts MAMACITA'S CRACK VIALS in his pocket. He no that -- POV LT - CU - The CIGAR BOX is inlaid with a CROSS, made costume jewels. Other strange symbols surround it. It cou be cursed -- or blessed. LT turns to go. The DOOR closes behind him. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: LT walks through the streets on the way to ARIANE'S. He  carries the CIGAR BOX. Suddenly, a SHOT rings out. ZOOM IN ON - CU LT  Horror. Doubtless it was meant for hi LT panics. Freezes. As in a dream, he cannot run. POV LT - RAPID. ERRATIC. HAND HELD - LT looks for SNIPERS the anonymous dark WINDOWS on the anonymous darks walls t create the mescarole canyon of the STREET. LT is entirely alone. He is stock-still, victim of his ow terror. Suddenly. LT can move. He takes out his GUN, presses hims against the nearest WALL. From that position, he hears -- A BRASH FEMALE VOICE, coming from somewhere in the darkne It is almost as loud as the "SHOT".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey motherfucker! Take that backfire  up the ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT can't believe that there is no "SNIPER", there was nev any SHOT. It was a BACKFIRE! ANGLE - The CAR in question passes by. It HONKS, defiantl Evidently, it is the CAR that had BACKFIRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT is still pressed against the wall, GUN at the ready. H cannot be relieved. The terror is with him.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: LT rushes in, triple bolts the DOOR behind him. He immedi pulls the DRAPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone just took a shot at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ariane laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, baby Sure And you don't do  cocaine, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT turns on her. Adamant. Pleading with her to believe hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the drugs, Ariane, it's --  it's someone who wants to kill me. (beat) You gotta believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIANE walks away, speaks with her back to LT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kick back, baby. Make yourself  at home. (suddenly pissed) But of course it won't be nobody's  home, if you don't come through with  the fucking rent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT lays his COAT down on the BED. Puts the CIGAR BOX of M under it. LT sits down near the PHONE. He lights his CRACKPIPE with MATCH from the MATCHBOOK on which LITE wrote the BOOKIE'S NUMBER. Then he tries to reach the BOOKIE. Some sort of w Mob joint answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is LARGE there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man. Lite gave ne this number.  OK? Just take a message. Tell Large  to fucking call me right away at 123- 1234. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CO -- phony humble) Sure, I get it... (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a good friend of Lite's, man.  It's urgent that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOB VOICE (CO) HANGS UP ON LT. LT tries to strangle the PHONE. LT REDIALS. The line is BUSY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ! Shit! I could kill them all  with my bare hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those fucking Mob assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT makes the strangulation gesture again. ARIANE laughs a him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere. You got some good blow, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then c'mere. I got something for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIANE pulls out a pristine NEEDLE.  LT comes but flinche at the sight. Apparently BOWTAY overheard that drugs are on the way. BO appears out of the KITCHEN. BOWTAY sits down near by, awaiting her DOSE. ARIANE starts preparing the DOSE. She's got all the  paraphernalia: SPOON. COTTON, a CANDLE FLAME, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First I'll put your Uptown in the  spoon, then, to make it more exciting,  I'm gonna add some Downtown. They  call this thing a speedball, honey,  but then you must know that... (beat -- she leans in) First time shooting up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it is. You're a virgin. Just  like that nun. And I'm gonna rape  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That decides it for LT. He sits down like a little boy an lets ARIANE shoot him up with the potent mixture of COCAI and HEROIN. ARIANE shoots up BOWTAY, next. They do it on the BED, exploiting all possible erotic  connotations. When LT rushes, he gets totally paranoid. Jumps at sounds sneaks to the WINDOW, hears noises that aren't there. Then he flips, and becomes crazy-bold. Opens the DRAPES.  Sticks his head out the WINDOW, waves his GUN at specters Then he becomes shit-scared, again. His behavior is lunat ARIANE LAUGHS at his antics. Finally LT becomes wildly sensual. Revealing himself with total abandon. Dances. In the midst of this -- The PHONE RINGS LT is seriously startled. Then he realize who it may be. He slowly answers the phone. LT can hardly speak. He is NUDE, and communicating from  another world syllable by syllable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Large?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, cop. I want my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still my money. If you want to  have a chance at any part of it,  shithead, you will take my $120,000  and bet on tomorrow's game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the money you owe me on  yesterday's game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yesterday's game. The World  Series is seven games not six. Put  in my bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to think about. Either  you put in my bet or you ain't getting  nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIG SILENCE on the PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CO -- lethal) Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really. I'm no fucking asshole,  man. I'm a fucking cop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, cop. I want you to give yourself  and your friends on the force a  message. Tell them I've got my own  reasons to be very interested in  whomever did the job on the nuns.  I'll double the Church reward if you  bring those punks direct to me. 100  G cash. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT absorbs this, then bursts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the nuns, man! I'm talking about  Strawberry! Is the bet down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARGE takes a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal: You meet me tonight  across from the Garden. 33rd & 8th.  At the beginning of the Ninth Inning.  We'll listen to the end of the game  together. You bring your cash, I'll  bring mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sucker. You better be there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT HANGS UP, turns to ARIANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe the nerve of this  fucking guy? He kills people for  fun, and then, he puts up 100 G to  bring in some guys who raped a nun.  What a sick fuck. Man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wiseguy. Paying 100 Grand for the  rapists if I turn then over direct  to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIANE'S eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you could do it, baby. We could  use the bread...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you could use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIANE SHRUGS, waves his dig aside. LT leaps up. He's on a manic roll. Conceives an insanely  captivating, impossible idea. As he speaks, he speeds mor and more until he seems to be reciting a rapid-fire tongu twister perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it, man! I will find those  kids. And I'll get the 50 G from the  Church! Then the kids'll go to jail. I'll be in charge, of course. After  a little while, I'll break the fuckers  out -- and I'll turn them in to  shithead I was just talking to. And  pick up his 100 G. No. I'll hit him  up for 200 G. Or 250 G. l can do it --  'cause I've got the kids. Then, of  course, there's the 180 G I'm gonna  pick up on the Game tonight -- when  the Strawberries win!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Strawberries"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mets. So anyway, chalk up another  180 G for the Game. Jesus Christ!  That's almost half a million dollars.  Ariane! Wait. That's not good enough,  I'll ask the shithead for 280 G for  the kids. Then it'll be a perfect  500 thousand. Yeah. Perfect. 280 G  for the kids. Yeah, it's good I  prepared, or I wouldn't have thought  to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIANE has been grooving on it until now. She sees a prob they've overlooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in) How come all those guys who're looking  to get 50 from the Church haven't  come up with shit? You got some kinda  inside track?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods -- dead serious) I'm a Catholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIANE LAUGHS, decides to go with it. LT, out of breath from his tirade, lets the Downtown half his dose kick in but good. He sits down in the same EASY CHAIR in which he nodded ou the morning of the desecration. Nodding out, he stares out the same WINDOW. His eyes clos As it was that morning only four days ago, the SUNRISE is blood red. As if it is LT'S DREAM, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAME SEVEN: LT GETS DOUBLE OR NOTHING: $120,000

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: CU - The ALABASTER NUN. She is lying cross -- probably ha been all night. VARIOUS ANGLES. The still-desecrated CHURCH in all its  enduring glory. Shafts of blood-red dawn-light. The NUN.

dialogues.speaker: TIME PASSES.
dialogues.text: VARIOUS ANGLES. Mid-morning; The NUN is still lying cross TIME PASSES. VARIOUS ANGLES. High Noon. The NUN is still lying cross. Suddenly -- LT appears in the doorway, a black silhouette against the white light of noon. For a moment, he watches her from a  distance. The NUN knows he is there. After a time, she gets up, goe to the altar, kneels. As if waiting for him. LT staggers down the center aisle. He's carrying the CIGA BOX. LT joins the NUN, kneeling next to her at the altar. ANGLE - The CHALICE is still missing. They are all alone. At the ALTAR, before the CRUCIFIX, LT confronts the NUN face to face. The NUN holds her ROSARY  BEADS. LT finally speaks. He thinks she'll be turned on by his o of "help".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Sister, listen to me  good. The other cops'll just put the  guys through the system. They're  juveniles. They'll walk! Get it? But  I'll beat the system and do justice.  Real justice. For you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NUN turns to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have already forgiven them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT is desperate. He lunges forward. Pleads with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on lady! They put out cigarettes  on your tits, man! Get with the  program! Don't you want them behind  bars? Or away from the world for  good? How could you forgive these  motherfu -- excuse me. These guys.  How could you? Deep down, don't you  want them to pay for what they did  to you? Don't you want the crime  avenged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have forgiven them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nun! These boys still have their  weapons, Sister. Your forgiveness  will leave blood in its wake. What  if they do it to other nuns? Other  virgins? Old women who die from the  shock? Do you have the rights let  these boys go free? Can you bear the  burden. Sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NUN turns to him, simple and pure, pure and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have prayed for days, Lieutenant.  I have prayed for the souls of the  boys who raped me. And I have prayed  for my own soul, too. I know what I  must do. And I know what I must not  do. (beat) But you -- you -- it is you who needs  to pray. Now, why do you want to  kill these boys? Why -- really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes yet another  tack) Look. Sister. No one has to get  killed. We can solve this together.  You and me -- as one. These boys are  lost sheep. Both Catholic -- did you  know that? And they're sick, Sister.  With a stress of the mind and of the  soul. They need help. Not just jail.  Not just psychiatry. They need the  help that only the Church can give.  Please help me to help them. Help me  find them before the others do. The  night is full of evil men, chasing  these boys with guns and clubs. We  have charity and love on our side. I  know that together, we could find  them first, even in the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good reasons are not always the  real reasons. Talk to Jesus,  Lieutenant. Pray. (beat) You do you believe in God -- don't  you? That Jesus Christ died for your  sins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This blows him away. He has nothing to say to that. The NUN has finished her morning prayers. For a moment, she looks deep into LT's eyes. Then she gets up and leaves LT alone in the CHURCH. LT comes face to face with the mammoth CRUCIFIX. He is  transfixed. POV - LT - JESUS on the CROSS. Soon, LT hears a VOICE. LT is not shocked or even surprised. He speaks to JESUS a to someone he's known all his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't forgive me. After what  I've done. (beat) I've fucked up bigtime. I've been  bad. Real bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Please don't forgive me.  I've always hated you for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV LT - The CRUCIFIX takes on an hallucinatory radiance. Taking that aura with him, JESUS comes down off the CROSS and moves toward LT, who is still kneeling at the ALTAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Why can't you hate me? Hate me!  Please! Help me! (confused) Hate me! Help me! Hate me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Jesus! Why me? Why can't I wash  the ashes from my forehead, year  after year after year? And why am I  still drunk on your blood, the taste  of your flesh on my tongue? Worst of  all, why can't I feel the nails in  my palms, the spear in my side, the  crown of thorns round my head? Why  do I have to know, over and over,  that it was you. You who died; died  for my sins! And that I will die for  nothing. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESUS kneels down, knee to knee, face to face with LT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I dream every night of the  whore who brought you water on your  road to death? And why have I never  forgotten that if she, then I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT averts his eyes. When he looks up again -- JESUS is back on the CROSS. Inert, and yet -- LT rises, moves around the interior of the CHURCH. He  stumbles, struggles, pleads. Falls, rises, falls and rise again -- as if wrestling with an invisible assailant. He collapses in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, my God. it's goddamn good to  be good. Forgive me. Father, for I  have sinned. It's still goddamn good  to be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: EPIPHANY. BLOODY CHRIST ON THE CROSS. HALLELUJAH
dialogues.text: In the aftermath of his revelation, he notices, cleanly, hunched, ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN carrying something toward th ALTAR. He staggers toward her. Yes. The ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN has

dialogues.speaker: CHALICE
dialogues.text: LT grabs the CHALICE. The ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN doesn't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chalice. Tell me! Who gave it to  you! Tell me where the fuck you got  it! Take me there! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, she doesn't speak at all. LT begins to CRY. Beg her to tell him. Then he wields his PISTOL, repeats his p Then breaks into TEARS. She speaks at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun in hand, LT gets down on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the name of God, you must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband will give me Hell, Mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already got Hell, Sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She meets LT's eyes, seems to understand something. Calml she tells him what he needs to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very hard. He's a -- you're not  a cop, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband is a fence. He got this  chalice from a couple of kids. Just  yesterday, I think. I stole it out  of his shop so as to return it to  where it ought to be. It's a holy  thing, you know. A holy thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN lets go of the CHALICE. Now LT ho ten CHALICE in his hands, alone. He speaks as if entrance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A holy thing. (beat -- snaps to) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly purposive, LT grabs the ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN by t arm. Starts pulling her out of the CHURCH. He holds the  CHALICE with the other arm, picks up the CIGAR BOX on his way out. Manages to carry both items. When LT and the ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN reach the door to out they both pause to GENUFLECT. Then LT grabs her again and they rush out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: LT walks the ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN swiftly through the stre toward the FENCE'S SHOP. He still holds the CHALICE and the CIGAR BOX. PEOPLE watch them pass and make way. As if they realize t something is happening -- on several levels at once. The  GAME has begun. It is on TV in every BAR and SHOP WINDOW. both English and Spanish. Slowly but surely, the Mets are losing.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: LT and the ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN enter the SHOP. LT is wiel the CHALICE and the CIGAR BOX. He has true madness m his  eyes. POV LT - The GAME is playing on a couple dozen TV's in th FENCE'S SHOP' The Mets are still losing! The FENCE, and elderly Black man, is sitting in one of ma EASY CHAIRS. He doesn't seem surprised to see his WIFE. O the CHALICE. Or LT! It's as if he expected them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took the chalice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought it back to the Church.  And then it made it's way back to  me, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThВ» FENCE bursts out LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna bring it back myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELDERLY BLACK WOMAN is obviously relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, woman! What did you think?  You thought I'd get mad like I did  that time you took that set of pots  and pans? That was twenty years ago.  And how do you compare pots and pans  and a chalice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT speaks up suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both hold stuff you eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat, the FENCE and his WIFE start LAUGHING. LT j in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to LT) So what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to know who brought in the  chalice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no mystery. Julio and Paolo  brought it in, (beat) You don't want to hurt those boys,  do you? I mean, they sure as Hell  have got something coming, but it  ain't what the Law wants to give  them. You understand? (beat -- shakes his  head) No. How could you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FENCE seems to study LT. POV FENCE - LT. Wretched. The FENCE thinks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- maybe you do. But I don't  know where those boys are at right  now. You'll have to ask around. Those  boys on the corner'll know. You'll  have to get it out of them. But they  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV LT - Through the WINDOW of the FENCE'S SHOP, a busy D CORNER is visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spaced) Thank you. And I'll make sure the  chalice gets back where it belongs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT leaves. CHALICE in hand.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: LT stumbles through the streets, questioning people about "JULIO and PAOLO". No one knows anything. LT stops people random, getting really desperate. He shows people the CHA asks them if they've seen it before. No one has. LT plays both ADDICT and COP as it suits his needs. By no he looks more like a homeless man than anything else. But none of his play-acting or lethal threats get him anywher The GAME is everywhere, and the Mets are still losing. Finally, LT approaches a hustling STREET DEALER. He cops. The STREET DEALER is wearing a WALKMAN, so the deal goes  down in mime. Now, LT speaks and wants to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Have you seen Paolo or Julio  around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STREET DEALER uses his WALKMAN and the resulting  "deafness" to excuse his total lack of response. LT starts MOUTHING WORDS silently at the STREET DEALER. N response. Then, he -- silently -- begins to shout. The STREET DEALER's alarmed that he seemingly can't hear all above the WALKMAN music. He moves the WALKMAN away fr his ears but doesn't take it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my Uncle used to wear a  walkman all the time. The walkman  looked just like yours. And you look  something like my Uncle. But one day  he was standing in a puddle -- the  puddle locked just like that one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT points to a PUDDLE in which the STREET DEALER is now  Standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he got electrocuted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STREET DEALER tries to consider what this crazy guy h just told him, but before the STREET DEALER can even reac LT leans in on him, shows his GUN and then his BADGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- I don't know you, and you  don't know me, but I'm really in the  mood to kill someone today and you  are at the end of my gun. (beat) Have you ever had days like that?  Yeah, you have, so now you understand  where I'm coming from. (beat) Tell me! Where is Julio and Paolo ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STREET DEALER answers with absolute ease. That was al it was about? No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were at that abandoned building  last night. Second floor. They're  probably still there now. It's next  to the old Convent. Downtown a ways.  You know the place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU. LT - It hits him. The CRACKHOUSE where the kids hang has always been right next to the CHURCH/CONVENT where it began! It suddenly makes sense to him. LT completes re transaction, pays the STREET DEALER for t DRUG BAGS. He takes the CASH out of the CIGAR BOX, reveal dozens of thousands of dollars. The STREET DEALER stares at the wretched man with a box f of cash.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: LT, carrying the CHALICE and the CIGAR BOX, heads back  Downtown toward the CRACKHOUSE -- and the CHURCH/CONVENT. In BARS, TV STORE WINDOWS, in snatches of strangers'  conversation, the FINAL GAME IS EVERYWHERE. The whole cit has stopped to watch it. LT is practically the only perso in the street. Worst of all, the Mets are seriously behind. They are  definitely LOSING. LT drags himself onward.

dialogues.speaker: EXT INT
dialogues.text: LT busts in. Fires shots, collars the KIDS. The KIDS are  wearing the PURPLE ROBES from the CHURCH/CONVENT. They al wear gold CROSSES. LT HANDCUFFS them. The other CRACKHEADS race out. There is even a TV in the CRACKHOUSE -- playing the GAME! The SOUND is Off. The Mets keep losing. If anything will  force LT to kill/and or take the KIDS into custody, this  would seem to be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fu--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Let's watch the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT sits down next to the KIDS. SMOKES with them, watches Game. LT must hold the PIPE for them, as they are HANDCUF LT gets them super-high, and himself likewise. He still h his GUN. The KIDS go along with it. Taking it moment to moment. All three, despite the situation, are heavily into the Ga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strawberry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, LT gets up. The KIDS understand that they must do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the robes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KIDS hand over the PURPLE ROBES and LT puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a cop are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT exits. Taking the KIDS along. He carries the CHALICE a the CIGAR BOX.

dialogues.speaker: VOUS
dialogues.text: VARIOUS ANGLES - LT drives toward the fatal rendez-vous w the BOOKIE. He is wearing the PURPLE ROBES from the  CHURCH/CONVENT and has the CHALICE and the CIGAR BOX. LT has the KIDS handcuffed in the back seat. (The Scene  mirrors Scene 2. in which LT drove his own TWINS to schoo The FINAL GAME (SEVEN) is on the RADIO. LT is listening, also not listening. LT talks wildly about Jesus Christ. And about the misery  they pass in the street. He waves his GUN wildly, punctua his speech with potentially lethal gestures. He aims the at JULIO and PAULO, then at himself, then out the window, then at the KIDS, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus died for your sins, you  motherfuckers! Not me. No. I didn't  die for your sins. No, not me. Jesus  went and did it. (beat) So why did you do what you did? If  you want to live, tell me now,  motherfuckers! Tell me now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT turns around and looks at JULIO and PAOLO, both of the HANDCUFFED in the back seat. POV LT - CU - JULIO and PAOLO both have TEARS running dow their cheeks. Silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT starts CRYING too, at the same time CURSING at the TRA He drives wildly toward the Port Authority Terminal. The Mets are coming up from behind -- but it is a long sh LT doesn't seem to care. He stares into space.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: LT stops his CAR -- next to a BUS in an underground tunne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KIDS do. LT follows fast. AT THE BUS: He makes them board at GUN POINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think you're not getting on  this bus, you're dead wrong. No  fucking way are you gonna miss this  bus, man! You were probably the kind  of kids who had your father drive  you to school cause you couldn't  catch the fucking bus. But no more,  man. You're getting on this bus and  you're taking it to the last fucking  stop. So get on the fucking bus,  man, 'cause you're life ain't worth  shit in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT uncuffs them and the KIDS get on the BUS, dumbstruck. LT hands JULIO the CIGAR BOX. His "salvation." The KIDS don't even know what is inside. They take it. LT gets back into his CAR, takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT/INT: EVENING - LT'S CAR - AT 33RD STREET & 8TH AV

dialogues.speaker: ARRIVAL OF THE BOOKIE.
dialogues.text: INT: STRAWBERRY is up. The GAME can go either way. Suspen But not on the face of LT. He is dressed in the PURPLE RO the CHALICE beside him in the CAR. The BOOKIE pulls up and -- without getting out of his CAR He SHOOTS LT in the head. The BOOKIE speeds off. (We never saw him behind the dark  windows,} LT is dead in his CAR. On the RADIO, the GAME is ending. STRAWBERRY hits a HOME and the -- Mets win, the CROWD ROARS. END CREDITS.
